intro: Gutierrezia solbrigii, commonly known as the desert gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sun-like appearance. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia solbrigii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sandy or gravelly habitats.
